title: 110_hr1394
content: The Act titled "Helping Our Students Communicate Act of 2007" expands loan forgiveness to speech-language pathologists. The "Helping Our Students Communicate Act of 2007" offers loan forgiveness to speech-language pathologists who have worked for 5 consecutive years in qualifying schools. The "Helping Our Students Communicate Act of 2007" provides loan forgiveness for speech-language pathologists with a graduate degree who have worked for 5 consecutive years in qualifying schools. The "Helping Our Students Communicate Act of 2007" offers loan forgiveness for speech-language pathologists with a graduate degree who have worked for 5 consecutive years in qualifying schools, meeting specific criteria for full-time employment. The "Helping Our Students Communicate Act of 2007" provides loan forgiveness for speech-language pathologists with a graduate degree who meet specific criteria for full-time employment in qualifying schools. New borrower eligibility for speech-language pathologists is outlined in the amendments made by this section. New borrower eligibility for speech-language pathologists with a graduate degree is defined in the Higher Education Act of 1965, starting from October 1, 2007.
